intro: Tekel micrantha, commonly known as the narrow-leaved hibiscus, is a flowering plant native to parts of Africa and Asia. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton plants. The plant is characterized by its small, pale yellow flowers and narrow, lance-shaped leaves. It typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forest understories. Tekel micrantha is often cultivated for its ornamental value and has traditional uses in some cultures.
